intro: Erysimum humile subsp. pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean wallflower, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant native to the Pyrenees region. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and features dense clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant has hairy, linear leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to full sun conditions. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
